Method Detail

setCell

public void setCell(java.lang.Integer position,
                    Cell cell)
Sets a pointer to the given Cell object at position in the Unit.

Parameters:
position - The index of the Cell object within the Unit.
cell - The Cell object to reference the pointer to.

get

public Cell get(java.lang.Integer index)
This returns the Cell object which lies at index in this Unit.

Note this returns a Cell object, which may not be set. It is the calling classe's responsibility to check the for existance before accessing the Cell's value.

Parameters:
index -
Returns:
Cell object which lies at index in this Unit

conflictCount

public java.lang.Integer conflictCount()
This method return the the sum of duplicate values in this unit.

Each unit may contain each number 1 to 9 once. The conflict count is incremented by 1 each time a number occurs more than once. So if this unit contains [1,3,4,1,1], its conflict count is 2.

Returns:
The the sum of duplicate values in this unit.
